Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core

Class CoreTexture2D

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D
public class CoreTexture2D extends Object
The CoreTexture2D represents a 2D texture in OpenGL space.

This class takes care of loading the texture in OpenGL and generating mipmaps as needed.

This class does not handle proxy textures. Note: Requires OpenGL 3.2 or greater.

  • Constructor Details

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull CoreTexture2D.ColorFormat format, int width, int height, @Nonnull Buffer data, @Nonnull CoreTexture2D.ResizeFilter filter)
      This is one of the simple constructors that only allow very limited possibilities for settings. However, they use settings that should cover most use cases.
      Parameters:
      format - The texture format.
      width - The width of the texture.
      height - The height of the texture.
      data - The pixel data.
      filter - The used filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull CoreTexture2D.ColorFormat format, boolean compressed, int width, int height, @Nonnull Buffer data, @Nonnull CoreTexture2D.ResizeFilter filter)
      This is one of the simple constructors that only allow very limited possibilities for settings. However, they use settings that should cover most use cases.
      Parameters:
      format - The texture format.
      compressed - true In case the internal texture data is supposed to be compressed if possible.
      width - The width of the texture.
      height - The height of the texture.
      data - The pixel data.
      filter - The used filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, int internalFormat, int width, int height, int format, @Nonnull Buffer data, @Nonnull CoreTexture2D.ResizeFilter filter)
      This constructor is a slightly reduced version that defines some common options automatically.
      Parameters:
      internalFormat - The internal format of the texture.
      width - The width of the texture in pixels.
      height - The height of the texture in pixels.
      format - The format of the pixel data.
      data - The pixel data.
      filter - The used filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, int internalFormat, int width, int height, int format, @Nonnull Buffer data, int magFilter, int minFilter)
      This constructor is a slightly reduced version that defines some common options automatically.
      Parameters:
      internalFormat - The internal format of the texture.
      width - The width of the texture in pixels.
      height - The height of the texture in pixels.
      format - The format of the pixel data.
      data - The pixel data.
      magFilter - The magnifying filter.
      minFilter - The minimizing filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, int target, int internalFormat, int width, int height, int format, @Nonnull Buffer data, int magFilter, int minFilter)
      This constructor is a slightly reduced version that defines some common options automatically.
      Parameters:
      target - The target type of the texture operations, has to be a valid 2D texture target.
      internalFormat - The internal format of the texture.
      width - The width of the texture in pixels.
      height - The height of the texture in pixels.
      format - The format of the pixel data.
      data - The pixel data.
      magFilter - The magnifying filter.
      minFilter - The minimizing filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

    • CoreTexture2D

      public CoreTexture2D(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, int textureId, int target, int level, int internalFormat, int width, int height, int border, int format, int type, @Nonnull Buffer data, int magFilter, int minFilter)
      This constructor allows you to define all the settings required to create a texture. Using this causes the class to disable all assumptions and do exactly what you want.
      Parameters:
      textureId - The ID that is supposed to be used with the texture, it has to be a valid texture ID for the selected target. Use AUTO to tell the class to fetch a texture ID in its own.
      target - The target type of the texture operations, has to be a valid 2D texture target.
      level - The mipmap level of the texture, in case you want the automated mipmap generation to kick in leave this value on 0 and selected a fitting minimizing filter.
      internalFormat - The internal format of the texture.
      width - The width of the texture in pixels.
      height - The height of the texture in pixels.
      border - The width of the border of the texture.
      format - The format of the pixel data.
      type - The data type of the pixel data.
      data - The pixel data.
      magFilter - The magnifying filter.
      minFilter - The minimizing filter.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case the creation of the texture fails for any reason.

  • Method Details

    • getMaxTextureSize

      public static int getMaxTextureSize(@Nonnull CoreGL gl)
      Fetches the maximum allowed size of a texture.
      Returns:
      The maximum size of a texture in pixels.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case reading the maximal texture size from OpenGL failed.

    • disableErrorChecking

      public static void disableErrorChecking()
      Disables error checking. No matter the nonsense you send into this class, everything will reach OpenGL. This should be done in case you are worries about the extra overhead caused by the error checks. Also, in case you just don't ever make mistakes you can safely disable error checking.

    • enableErrorChecking

      public static void enableErrorChecking()
      Enables error checking. It is enabled by default so you don't need to call this unless you disabled error checking at some point.

    • bind

      public void bind()
      Binds the texture to the current context.
      Throws:
      GLException - In case binding the texture fails.

      Throws:
